Ingest_LDD.name: Cartography
Ingest_LDD.comment: Contains classes and attributes used to describe cartographic products. This information is largely adapted from the FGDC "Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata".

DD_Attribute.name: west_bounding_coordinate
DD_Attribute.definition: The west_bounding_coordinate attribute provides the western-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in longitude.

Terminological_Entry.name: west_bounding_coordinate
Terminological_Entry.definition: The west_bounding_coordinate attribute provides the western-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in longitude.

Terminological_Entry.name: West_Bounding_Coordinate
Terminological_Entry.definition: western-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in longitude

Terminological_Entry.name: westbc
Terminological_Entry.definition: western-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in longitude

Terminological_Entry.name: WESTERNMOST_LONGITUDE
Terminological_Entry.definition:
The following definitions describe westernmost longitude for the body-fixed, rotating coordinate systems:
For Planetocentric coordinates and for Planetographic coordinates in which longitude increases toward the east, the westernmost (leftmost) longitude of a spatial area (e.g.,a map, mosaic, bin,feature or region) is the minimum numerical value of longitude unless it crosses the Prime Meridian.
For Planetographic coordinates in which longitude increases toward the west (prograde rotator), the westernmost (leftmost) longitude of a spatial area (e.g., a map,mosaic, bin, feature or region) is the maximum numerical value of longitude unless it crosses the Prime Meridian.
For the Earth, Moon and Sun, PDS also supports the traditional use of the range (-180,180) in which case the westernmost (leftmost) longitude is the minimum numerical value of longitude unless it crosses -180.

DD_Attribute.name: east_bounding_coordinate
DD_Attribute.definition: The east_bounding_coordinate attribute provides the eastern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in longitude.

Terminological_Entry.name: east_bounding_coordinate
Terminological_Entry.definition: The east_bounding_coordinate attribute provides the eastern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in longitude.

Terminological_Entry.name: East_Bounding_Coordinate
Terminological_Entry.definition: eastern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in longitude

Terminological_Entry.name: eastbc
Terminological_Entry.definition: eastern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in longitude

Terminological_Entry.name: EASTERNMOST_LONGITUDE
Terminological_Entry.definition:
The following definitions describe easternmost longitude for the body-fixed, rotating coordinate systems:
For Planetocentric coordinates and for Planetographic coordinates in which longitude increases toward the east, the easternmost (rightmost) longitude of a spatial area (e.g.,a map, mosaic, bin,feature or region) is the maximum numercial value of longitude unless it crosses the Prime Meridian.
For Planetographic coordinates in which longitude increases toward the west, the easternmost (rightmost) longitude of a spatial area (e.g., a map, mosaic, bin, feature or region) is the minimum numerical value of longitude unless it crosses the Prime Meridian.
For the Earth, Moon and Sun, PDS also supports the traditional use of the range (-180,180) in which case the easternmost (rightmost) longitude is the maximum numerical value of longitude unless it crosses 180.

DD_Attribute.name: north_bounding_coordinate
DD_Attribute.definition: The north_bounding_coordinate attribute provides the northern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in latitude.

Terminological_Entry.name: north_bounding_coordinate
Terminological_Entry.definition: The north_bounding_coordinate attribute provides the northern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in latitude.

Terminological_Entry.name: North_Bounding_Coordinate
Terminological_Entry.definition: northern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in latitude

Terminological_Entry.name: northbc
Terminological_Entry.definition: northern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in latitude

Terminological_Entry.name: MAXIMUM_LATITUDE
Terminological_Entry.definition: The maximum_latitude element specifies the northernmost latitude of a spatial area, such as a map, mosaic, bin, feature, or region.

DD_Attribute.name: south_bounding_coordinate
DD_Attribute.definition: The south_bounding_coordinate attribute provides the southern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in latitude.

Terminological_Entry.name: south_bounding_coordinate
Terminological_Entry.definition: The south_bounding_coordinate attribute provides the southern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in latitude.

Terminological_Entry.name: South_Bounding_Coordinate
Terminological_Entry.definition: southern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in latitude

Terminological_Entry.name: southbc
Terminological_Entry.definition: southern-most coordinate of the limit of coverage expressed in latitude

Terminological_Entry.name: MINIMUM_LATITUDE
Terminological_Entry.definition: The minimum_latitude element specifies the southernmost latitude of a spatial area, such as a map, mosaic, bin, feature, or region.

DD_Attribute.name: horizontal_datum_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The horizontal_datum_name attribute provides the identification given to reference system used for defining the coordinates of points.
DD_Attribute.comment: Needs additional standard values for other planets.

DD_Attribute.name: ellipsoid_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The ellipsoid_name attribute provides the identification given to established representations of a planet's shape.
DD_Attribute.comment: Needs additional standard values for other planets.

DD_Attribute.name: semi_major_radius
DD_Attribute.definition: The semi_major_axis attribute provides the radius of the equatorial axis of the ellipsoid.

DD_Attribute.name: semi_minor_radius
DD_Attribute.definition: The semi_minor_radius attribute provides the value of the intermediate axis of the ellipsoid that defines the approximate shape of a target body. The semi-minor axis is usually in the equatorial plane.
DD_Attribute.comment: Check definition with Chris. Was this in FGDC model, or added by PDS?

DD_Attribute.name: polar_radius
DD_Attribute.definition: The polar_radius attribute provides the value of the semiminor axis of the ellipsoid that defines the approximate shape of a target body. The polar radius is normal to the plane defined by the semi-major and semi-minor axes.
DD_Attribute.comment: Something is wrong with the definition. Need to consult Chris.

DD_Attribute.name: longitude_direction
DD_Attribute.definition: The longitude_direction attribute identifies the direction of longitude (e.g. POSITIVE_EAST or POSITIVE_WEST) for a planet. The IAU definition for direction of positive longitude is adopted. Typically, for planets with prograde rotations, positive longitude direction is to the west. For planets with retrograde rotations, positive longitude direction is to the east. Note: The longitude_direction attribute should be used for planetographc systems, but not for planetocentric.

DD_Attribute.name: latitude_resolution
DD_Attribute.definition: The latitude_resolution attribute indicates the minimum difference between two adjacent latitude values expressed in angular units of measure.

DD_Attribute.name: longitude_resolution
DD_Attribute.definition: The longitude_resolution attribute indicates the minimum difference between two adjacent longitude values expressed in angular units of measure.

DD_Attribute.name: local_description
DD_Attribute.definition: The local_description attribute provides a description of the coordinate system and its orientation to the surface of a planet.

DD_Attribute.name: local_georeference_information
DD_Attribute.definition: The local_description attribute provides a description of the information provided to register the local system to a planet (e.g. control points, satellite ephemeral data, inertial navigation data).

DD_Attribute.name: planar_coordinate_encoding_method
DD_Attribute.definition: The planar_coordinate_encoding_method attribute indicates the means used to represent horizontal positions.

DD_Attribute.name: map_projection_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The map_projection_name attribute provides the name of the map projection.

DD_Attribute.name: grid_coordinate_system_name
DD_Attribute.definition: The grid_coordinate_system_name attribute provides the name of the grid coordinate system.

DD_Attribute.name: local_planar_description
DD_Attribute.definition: The local_planar_description attribute provides a description of the local planar system.

DD_Attribute.name: local_planar_georeference_information
DD_Attribute.definition: The local_planar_georeference_information attribute provides a description of the information provided to register the local planar system to a planet (e.g. control points, satellite ephemeral data, inertial navigation data).

DD_Attribute.name: abscissa_resolution
DD_Attribute.definition: The abscissa_resolution attribute provides the (nominal) minimum distance between the "x" or column values of two adjacent points.

DD_Attribute.name: ordinate_resolution
DD_Attribute.definition: The ordinate_resolution attribute provides the (nominal) minimum distance between the "y" or row values of two adjacent points.

DD_Attribute.name: distance_resolution
DD_Attribute.definition: The distance_resolution attribute provides the minimum distance measurable between two points, expressed in Planar Distance Units of measure.

DD_Attribute.name: bearing_resolution
DD_Attribute.definition: The bearing_resolution attribute provides the minimum angle measurable between two points.

DD_Attribute.name: bearing_reference_direction
DD_Attribute.definition: The bearing_reference_direction attribute specifies the direction from which the bearing is measured.

DD_Attribute.name: bearing_reference_meridian
DD_Attribute.definition: The bearing_reference_meridian attribute specifies the axis from which the bearing is measured.

DD_Attribute.name: standard_parallel
DD_Attribute.definition: The standard_parallel attribute defines the line of constant latitude at which the surface of the planet and the plane or developable surface intersect.

DD_Attribute.name: longitude_of_central_meridian
DD_Attribute.definition: The longitude_of_central_meridian attribute defines the line of longitude at the center of a map projection generally used as the basis for constructing the projection.

DD_Attribute.name: latitude_of_projection_origin
DD_Attribute.definition: The latitude_of_projection_origin attribute defines the defines the latitude chosen as the origin of rectangular coordinates for a map projection.

DD_Attribute.name: scale_factor_at_center_line
DD_Attribute.definition: The scale_factor_at_center_line attribute provides a multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance along the center line.

DD_Attribute.name: scale_factor_at_projection_origin
DD_Attribute.definition: The scale_factor_at_projection_origin attribute provides a multiplier for reducing a distance tbd.

DD_Attribute.name: straight_vertical_longitude_from_pole
DD_Attribute.definition: The straight_vertical_longitude_from_pole attribute provides the longitude oriented straight up from the North or South Pole.

DD_Attribute.name: scale_factor_at_central_meridian
DD_Attribute.definition: The scale_factor_at_central_meridian attribute provides a multiplier for reducing a distance obtained from a map by computation or scaling to the actual distance along the central meridian.

DD_Attribute.name: utm_zone_number
DD_Attribute.definition: The utm_zone_number attribute provides the identifier for the UTM zone.

DD_Attribute.name: ups_zone_identifier
DD_Attribute.definition: The ups_zone_identifier attribute provides an identifier for the UPS zone.

DD_Attribute.name: spcs_zone_identifier
DD_Attribute.definition: The spcs_zone_identifier attribute identifies the SPCS zone.

DD_Attribute.name: azimuthal_angle
DD_Attribute.definition: The azimuthal_angle attribute provides the angle measured clockwise from north, and expressed in degrees.

DD_Attribute.name: azimuth_measure_point_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: The azimuth_measure_point_longitude attribute provides the longitude of the map projection origin.

DD_Attribute.name: oblique_line_latitude
DD_Attribute.definition: The oblique_line_latitude attribute provides the latitude of a point defining the oblique line.

DD_Attribute.name: oblique_line_longitude
DD_Attribute.definition: The oblique_line_longitude attribute provides the longitude of a point defining the oblique line.

DD_Class.name: Cartography
DD_Class.definition: The Cartography class provides a description of how a 3D sphere, spheroid, or elliptical spheroid or the celestial sphere is mapped onto a plane.

Terminological_Entry.name: Cartography
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Cartography class provides a description of how a 3D sphere, spheroid, or elliptical spheroid or the celestial sphere is mapped onto a plane.

DD_Class.name: Spatial_Domain
DD_Class.definition: The Spatial_Domain class describes the geographic areal domain of the data set.

Terminological_Entry.name: Spatial_Domain
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Spatial_Domain class describes the geographic areal domain of the data set.

DD_Class.name: Spatial_Reference_Information
DD_Class.definition: The Spatial_Reference_Information class provides a description of the reference frame for, and the means to encode, coordinates in a data set.

Terminological_Entry.name: Spatial_Reference_Information
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Spatial_Reference_Information class provides a description of the reference frame for, and the means to encode, coordinates in a data set.

DD_Class.name: Bounding_Coordinates
DD_Class.definition: The Bounding_Coordinates class defines the limits of coverage of a set of data expressed by latitude and longitude values in the order western-most, eastern-most, northern-most, and southern-most.

Terminological_Entry.name: Bounding_Coordinates
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Bounding_Coordinates class defines the limits of coverage of a set of data expressed by latitude and longitude values in the order western-most, eastern-most, northern-most, and southern-most.

DD_Class.name: Horizontal_Coordinate_System_Definition
DD_Class.definition: The Horizontal_Coordinate_System_Definition class provides the reference frame or system from which linear or angular quantities are measured and assigned to the position that a point occupies.

Terminological_Entry.name: Horizontal_Coordinate_System_Definition
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Horizontal_Coordinate_System_Definition class provides the reference frame or system from which linear or angular quantities are measured and assigned to the position that a point occupies.

DD_Class.name: Geodetic_Model
DD_Class.definition: The Geodetic_Model class provides parameters describing the shape of the planet.

Terminological_Entry.name: Geodetic_Model
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Geodetic_Model class provides parameters describing the shape of the planet.

DD_Class.name: Geographic
DD_Class.definition: The Geographic class provides information about the quantities of latitude and longitude which define the position of a point on a planetary body's surface with respect to a reference spheroid.

Terminological_Entry.name: Geographic
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Geographic class provides information about the quantities of latitude and longitude which define the position of a point on a planetary body's surface with respect to a reference spheroid.

DD_Class.name: Planar
DD_Class.definition: The Planar class provides the quantities of distances, or distances and angles, which define the position of a point on a reference plane to which the surface of a planet has been projected.

Terminological_Entry.name: Planar
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Planar class provides the quantities of distances, or distances and angles, which define the position of a point on a reference plane to which the surface of a planet has been projected.

DD_Class.name: Local
DD_Class.definition: The Local class provides a description of any coordinate system that is not aligned with the surface of the planet.

Terminological_Entry.name: Local
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Local class provides a description of any coordinate system that is not aligned with the surface of the planet.

DD_Class.name: Planar_Coordinate_Information
DD_Class.definition: The Planar_Coordinate_Information class provides information about the coordinate system developed on the planar surface.

DD_Class.name: Map_Projection
DD_Class.definition: The Map_Projection class provides the systematic representation of all or part of the surface of a planet on a plane or developable surface.

Terminological_Entry.name: Map_Projection
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Map_Projection class provides the systematic representation of all or part of the surface of a planet on a plane or developable surface.

DD_Class.name: Grid_Coordinate_System
DD_Class.definition: The Grid_Coordinate_System class defines a plane-rectangular coordinate system usually based on, and mathematically adjusted to, a map projection so that geographic positions can be readily transformed to and from plane coordinates.

Terminological_Entry.name: Grid_Coordinate_System
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Grid_Coordinate_System class defines a plane-rectangular coordinate system usually based on, and mathematically adjusted to, a map projection so that geographic positions can be readily transformed to and from plane coordinates.

DD_Class.name: Local_Planar
DD_Class.definition: The Local_Planar class defines any right-handed planar coordinate system of which the z-axis coincides with a plumb line through the origin that locally is aligned with the surface of the planet.

Terminological_Entry.name: Local_Planar
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Local_Planar class defines any right-handed planar coordinate system of which the z-axis coincides with a plumb line through the origin that locally is aligned with the surface of the planet.

DD_Class.name: Coordinate_Representation
DD_Class.definition: The Coordinate_Representation class provides the method of encoding the position of a point by measuring its distance from perpendicular reference axes (the "coordinate pair" and "row and column" methods).

DD_Class.name: Distance_and_Bearing_Representation
DD_Class.definition: The Distance_and_Bearing_Representation class provides a method of encoding the position of a point by measuring its distance and direction (azimuth angle) from another point.

DD_Class.name: Equirectangular
DD_Class.definition: The Equirectangular class contains parameters for the Equirectangular projection.

Terminological_Entry.name: Equirectangular
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Equirectangular class contains parameters for the Equirectangular projection.

DD_Class.name: Lambert_Conformal_Conic
DD_Class.definition: The Lambert_Conformal_Conic class contains parameters for the Lambert Conformal Conic projection.

Terminological_Entry.name: Lambert_Conformal_Conic
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Lambert_Conformal_Conic class contains parameters for the Lambert Conformal Conic projection.

DD_Class.name: Oblique_Mercator
DD_Class.definition: The Oblique_Mercator class contains parameters for the Oblique Mercator projection.

Terminological_Entry.name: Oblique_Mercator
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Oblique_Mercator class contains parameters for the Oblique Mercator projection.

DD_Class.name: Polar_Stereographic
DD_Class.definition: The Polar_Stereographic class contains parameters for the Polar Stereographic projection.

DD_Class.name: Polyconic
DD_Class.definition: The Polyconic class contains parameters for the Polyconic projection.

DD_Class.name: Sinusoidal
DD_Class.definition: The Sinusoidal class contains parameters for the Sinusoidal projection.

DD_Class.name: Transverse_Mercator
DD_Class.definition: The Transverse_Mercator class contains parameters for the Transverse Mercator projection.

DD_Class.name: Universal_Transverse_Mercator
DD_Class.definition: The Universal_Transverse_Mercator class defines a grid system based on the transverse mercator projection, applied between latitudes 84 degrees north and 80 degrees south on the planet's surface.

Terminological_Entry.name: Universal_Transverse_Mercator
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Universal_Transverse_Mercator class defines a grid system based on the transverse mercator projection, applied between latitudes 84 degrees north and 80 degrees south on the planet's surface.

DD_Class.name: Universal_Polar_Stereographic
DD_Class.definition: The Universal_Polar_Stereographic class defines a grid system based on the polar stereographic projection, applied to the planet's polar regions north of 84 degrees north and south of 80 degrees south.

Terminological_Entry.name: Universal_Polar_Stereographic
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Universal_Polar_Stereographic class defines a grid system based on the polar stereographic projection, applied to the planet's polar regions north of 84 degrees north and south of 80 degrees south.

DD_Class.name: State_Plane_Coordinate_System
DD_Class.definition: The State_Plane_Coordinate_System class defines a plane-rectangular coordinate system established for each state in the United States by the National Geodetic Survey.

Terminological_Entry.name: State_Plane_Coordinate_System
Terminological_Entry.definition: The State_Plane_Coordinate_System class defines a plane-rectangular coordinate system established for each state in the United States by the National Geodetic Survey.

DD_Class.name: Oblique_Line_Azimuth
DD_Class.definition: The Oblique_Line_Azimuth class defines the method used to describe the line along which an oblique mercator map projection is centered using the map projection origin and an azimuth.

Terminological_Entry.name: Oblique_Line_Azimuth
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Oblique_Line_Azimuth class defines the method used to describe the line along which an oblique mercator map projection is centered using the map projection origin and an azimuth.

DD_Class.name: Oblique_Line_Point
DD_Class.definition: The Oblique_Line_Point class defines the method used to describe the line along which an oblique mercator map projection is centered using two points near the limits of the mapped region that define the center line.

Terminological_Entry.name: Oblique_Line_Point
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Oblique_Line_Point class defines the method used to describe the line along which an oblique mercator map projection is centered using two points near the limits of the mapped region that define the center line.

DD_Class.name: Oblique_Line_Point_Group
DD_Class.definition: The Oblique_Line_Point_Group class provides the coordinates in latitude and longitude of one end point of the line along which an oblique mercator map projection is centered.

Terminological_Entry.name: Oblique_Line_Point_Group
Terminological_Entry.definition: The Oblique_Line_Point_Group class provides the coordinates in latitude and longitude of one end point of the line along which an oblique mercator map projection is centered.

DD_Class.name: Map_Projection_Base
DD_Class.definition: An abstract class that serves as the parent class to all the map projections.
